Key Match Events: Francisco Alvarez exited the Mets' game early due to back spasms in the top of the seventh of an 8-4 loss to the Brewers
Pre-Game Insights: Mets catcher Francisco Lindor made his return from back discomfort
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Carlos Mendoza expressed concern for Alvarez's injury and stated the club has catchers at camp in Port St. Lucie who could be added if needed
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets were outplayed and outrun by the NL Central champion Brewers, who stole six bases, including three by Brice Turang
Others: Alvarez's bat has come alive in the past two weeks, having launched five of his 11 home runs this season in the past 12 games
